title: PGPD Arrests Suspect Who Attempted to Sexually Assault Woman in Camp Springs
body:
Detectives charged a suspect who attempted to
sexually assault a woman in her Camp Springs home. The suspect is 23-year-old
Khary Edwards of the 4000 block of Wahler Court in Southeast DC. The suspect
and victim do not know each other.

On October 21, at about 11:55 am, patrol officers were called to
the victim’s home on Oakland Way. When the first officer arrived, he observed
the suspect, who was naked, running from the home. The officer chased the
suspect but lost sight of him in the 5800 block of Auth Road. While canvassing
the area, officers located the then clothed suspect walking on Auth Road and
took him into custody after another foot chase. The preliminary investigation reveals the suspect had forced his
way into the woman’s home and attempted to sexually assault her. He also
assaulted her and stole items from the home. He ran out when the first patrol
officer arrived on the scene. Edwards is charged with attempted murder, attempted rape, robbery
and additional charges. He’s in custody of the Department of Corrections on a
no-bond status.Anyone with information about this case or this
suspect is asked to call the Sexual Assault Unit at 301-772-4908. Callers
wishing to remain anonymous may call Crime Solvers at 1-866-411-TIPS (8477),
text “PGPD plus your message” to CRIMES (274637) on your cell phone or go to http://www.pgpolice.org and submit a tip
online.
